block.p: Debt * Chase Manhattan Corp. has filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission for up to $1 billion in debt securities and warrants, and in a separate filing, for up to $250 million in preferred stock.

Debt * Chase Manhattan Corp. has filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission for up to $1 billion in debt securities and warrants, and in a separate filing, for up to $250 million in preferred stock.

* Citicorp has filed for a shelf offering of up to $1.5 billion in notes, warrants to buy notes and currency warrants. * Commercial Credit Co. is offering $150 million in 7.7 percent notes due 1995 at a price of 100 through Lehman Brothers. The noncallable notes are rated A-2 by Moody's and A by S.& P. * Dayton Hudson Corp. has filed for up to $600 million in debt securities and warrants. * Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corp., or Freddie Mac, is offering $200 million in 7.94 percent notes due in 1998 at a price of 100 through Merrill Lynch. * SBC Finance Cayman Islands Ltd. is offering $200 million in 7 3/4 percent five-year Eurobonds at a price to yield 7.58 percent through Swiss Bank Corp. The bonds are guaranteed by Swiss Bank and rated triple-A by both Moody's and S.& P. Common Stock * Barra Inc., Berkeley, Calif., has filed for an initial public offering of 1.2 million common shares through Hambrecht & Quist Inc. * Infrasonics Inc., a San Diego-based maker of respirators, is offering 1.5 million common shares at $7.75 a share through Kemper Securities. Ratings * Sequa Corp.'s senior unsecured debt rating has been increased to BB+, from BBB- and subordinated debt to BB-, from BB+ by S.& P. The company is based in New York City. * Southdown Inc.'s senior suborinated debt is under review for possible downgrading by S.& P. The company is based in Houston.
